question: 過去形
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>past</kanji> <kanji>shape</kanji> is how things were in the past. To describe those things (like you would with an adjective, aka <ja>形容詞</ja>), you'd use <vocabulary>past tense</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
